original_title: Softlogic Life leadership expresses strong confidence in Sri Lanka’s insurance sector
original_body_lines: Iftikar Ahamed, Managing Director of Softlogic Life, recently reaffirmed his optimism regarding the future of life and health insurance in Sri Lanka, citing the company’s strong performance and strategic expansion efforts as key drivers of growth.

“We remain optimistic about the prospects for Life and Health insurance in Sri Lanka,” Ahamed stated. “Our results in the first half of the year are a testament to our proactive mindset and the resilience of our team in driving sustainable business performance while delivering on our core purpose of protecting lives.”

The company recently acquired Allianz Life Insurance Lanka Limited, now a subsidiary of Softlogic Life Insurance PLC. Ahamed emphasised that this move aligns with the company’s mission to extend protection to more Sri Lankans. “As we move ahead together, we will continue to innovate and challenge industry norms to drive a better quality of life for Sri Lankans,” he added.

Supporting this vision, Ashok Pathirage, Chairman of Softlogic Life, highlighted the company’s disciplined execution and customer-centric approach. “Our strong performance in the 1st Half reflects the power of clear focus, disciplined execution, and a relentless commitment to standing with our customers,” Pathirage noted. He also credited the company’s digital-first strategy and innovation pipeline for sustaining growth and strengthening its market position.

Softlogic Life’s robust half-year results, including a Gross Written Premium (GWP) of LKR 18.7 billion, a 29% year-on-year increase, underscore its industry leadership. The company achieved the highest absolute GWP growth in the sector during this period.
With a decade-long compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 26%, significantly outpacing the industry average of 15%, Softlogic Life continues to set benchmarks in Sri Lanka’s insurance landscape.
